title: Recognition of success as Support (A solution i propose to reward Supports to get more gold)
body:
Well Riot wants to make Supporting more attractive and i'm thinking there is a way to make Supports earn more gold without allowing other roles to abuse it.

Make it detect how much damage and how many wards you are using per minute. Support players usually deal less damage than everyone else and this way, mage Supports who hard carry get enough gold anyway and won't be tagged as "Support". If you are tagged as Support you get extra gold.

And this means total damage, not damage to champions. Otherwise, everything would be a bro lane. Propably should be combined with a number of other factor such as damage taken and how many wards placed. I feel like this should trigger until after Sightstone has been bought just to make sure. High accuracy is crucial here to prevent gold income abuse.

Anyway that's what i think. Discuss below.

replies.body:
It's tricky.

Whether they get recognition for it or not, supports are currently quite impactful at their current levels of gold and xp.

They typically don't get much recognition for it, and they don't *feel* impactful since they're usually not chunking down enemy carries, but they are there, making plays and turning around fights and so on, sometimes realistically being the ones carrying the team despite their gold/xp.

If things change to make supports get more gold or more xp, then we're potentially in the situation where supports are completely OP. I don't know how to fix that without breaking the role entirely as far as gameplay goes.

More recognition through stat tracking and pentassists could maybe be possible and could help with some of peoples issues with support, but I worry they can't change much about the gameplay without fundamentally altering how support works, and that's a very scary proposition for people who like support in it's current form (and probably for adcs who like having someone focused on helping them, at least for the early game).

You could be right. But I feel like garbage when I am confronted by the 0/20 Heim and I ended up killed and that 1v1 due to the lack of (Offensive abilities if primary supporting champion or gold if anything else). So players feel like they do not have an impact when the enemy top was crushed to heck and still manages to kill you 1v1.

I feel like supports in their current form have all the tools needed (e.g. sightstone/shields and heals on item actives) to never be confronted with a fight they don't want, so if the support is caught out (and they shouldn't be due to the sightstone), they should be able to get out anyway if played well. If you're actually trying to fight it, then you're probably playing the wrong role.

Getting people to tunnel on me as a support I often enjoy, because that to me is a victory. I am unlikely to actually die unless they burn some serious summoners/ults, and if they do that then my team *should* be able to promptly punish them for that (which my teams have generally gotten better at as I've inched up through the elos).

Each of the roles as they exist currently appeal to a different playstyle, and support is one for people who enjoy offering utility and playmaking, not necessarily getting kills themselves. The demographic who likes that sort of thing may not be as broad as some of the other roles, but changing it to me seems like it'd just be shifting the appeal to people who are already satisfied by another role, and leaving the ones who do like support as it currently exists with nothing.

You don't understand the support problem at all. I play supp, and it is easy to get xp or gold. But for what?

The problem everybody knows but no-one talks about: the presence problem. 

Early game presence is weak: in the past you were able to get kills on bot without jungler help. Now because of the strong regen/heal abilities, you cannot do anything in early game unless the other bot lane is stupid. It is nice to reduce the enemy hp by 80%, but they run back under tower, regen back in two minutes and your efforts are meaningless. So trading after some games are very boring, since decent supports knows how to protect themselves and the adc (that is their role). Summary: early game is boring unless the enemy does stupid things (e.g. no warding).

Mid game presence: this is where most supports shine. The problem is that mid game last for 10 minutes. So from a 40 minute game you can enjoy a 10 minute part. Congratulations riot.

Late game presence is weak: your 1.5 sec stun is meaningless against 10000 hp tanks, your skillshots can be avoided by items the others bought (protobelt, etc.). So what can you do? Warding, initiate a teamfight, and hoping to catch somebody with cc, but if the team cannot capitalize, these are meaningless.

In the end you feel in the majority of the time you cannot influence the game. You have NO choices, you need to adapt the team choices. You can only HOPING that a team is able to capitalize on a good CC. I just saw some stream recently, and the top laner said that olaf annoys me, I kill it, and he did it. When I am annoyed by a karma, what can I do?

So what supports need: tools for having a greater presence. What about a consumable item (only supports can buy it), which allows destroying an item in the enemy inventory? Frightening isn't it? But that would give supports a presence they need. Even though they still cannot kill anybody, but they could influence games :)
